RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eli gibility)(Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ARROWWOOD settled back inside on the opening turn then eased out into the backstretch, started a bid toward the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path then dug in through the final furlong and took over late yards. BEST VIRGINIA stalked three wide, bid approaching the three eighths pole and closed for the nod at the quarter pole, contested even terms off the rail on the far turn, dug in to put WINDSOR'S PLAY away inside the sixteenth pole but was outfinished in late yards. The latter moved to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure past the seven sixteenths pole, was met at the quarter, contested even terms nearest the rail on the far turn and remained a close factor to later yards before relenting. LADY CINCO DE MAYO came away awkwardly then stalked off the rail, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole but dropped back past the five sixteenths and flattened at the rail on the far turn. SUPERSTASIA raced four wide on the first turn, showed little response through the backstretch and was eased the final quarter. MOIRAINE raced five wide on the opening turn, showed little response through the backstretch and was eased into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Arrowwood
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside,eased out 1/2,bid 5/16,4p far turn,up late yards

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Cinco de Mayo
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,stalked off rail,challenged 7/16,flattened far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Best Virginia
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Conrad Randall R

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE FEBRUARY 12, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since February 12 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,5 00, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GILLIGAN veered outward and made contact with Make The Way Clear leaving the gate then stalked inside, bid approaching the three eighths pole, contested even terms two deep inside the quarter then dug in under steady encouragement to take over the final strides. MY MIRACLE MAN was bumped leaving the gate but took the lead past the thirteen sixteenths pole and rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths, was met leaving the quarter pole and contested even terms nearest the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady handling but was caught in the final strides. WE B SHACKIN rounded the first turn in the four path, picked up the chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and closed the gap in the lane. TOUGH TO TAME was forced out at the start then raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, eased out in the upper stretch and closed through the lane. MAKE THE WAY CLEAR was bumped outward and into My Miracle Man leaving the gate, raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase toward the three eighths pole but showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Gilligan
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus and Joy Kevin J

ENTRY.NAME: Tough to Tame
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out break,3p 1st turn,chased 3/8,rail far turn,closed lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SCARLET REBEL gave chase and took the lead two deep approaching the quarter pole, dueled clear nearing the head of the lane and dug in under steady encouragement to hold on. VERY VENUS exchanged contact with XTENDED STREAK leaving the gate then gave chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn, was eased to the four path entering the stretch and finished well to clear second in the final yards, while gaining on the winner. The latter exchanged contact with Very Venus leaving the gate then chased inside, was eased to the three path entering the stretch, dug in leaving the turn but flattened in late yards. TAPTAP chased inside through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail, eased out leaving the turn and finished evenly to pass rivals. OPPO TACO gave early chase toward the outside, raced two deep on the turn and showed little in the lane. CAJUN CASHEW set a pressured pace through the backstretch, was met at the rail nearing the quarter pole then flattened leaving the turn. LAURA'S GRAND chased toward the inside, rounded the turn at the rail and showed little in the lane. PALACIO gave chase then faded in the three path on the turn. BIT OF BLESSINGS gave chase and saved ground on the turn. PLAYING FOR TWO chased early then weakened widest on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Taptap
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,off rail turn,eased out 1/8,passed rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Cashew
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,met rail near 1/4,flattened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 84. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 12 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considere d In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHROMATIC LASS saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole then eased to the four path on the far turn, dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn and got up in late yards. HESSICA settled off the rail on the first turn, edged closer leaving the half mile pole, dueled to even terms three wide midway on the far turn, had the nod entering the stretch and dug in under steady handling, but was caught in late yards. AIM'S JUBILEE took the lead two deep approaching the nine sixteenths pole and rated the pace, came under pressure past the three eighths, was met toward the quarter pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and ran evenly in the stretch. MUSIC LASS set the early pace inside, was headed approaching the nine sixteenths pole and stalked from that point, challenged toward the three eighths, took a brief lead at the rail nearing the quarter pole but was met leaving the turn and flattened inside the sixteenth pole. ST MAARTEN GIRL rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase from the three eighths pole but showed little response. WICKED SAUCY rounded the opening turn in the three path, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, weakened in the three path on the far turn and was eased in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Hessica
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,closed from1/2,even terms 3wd mid turn,up1/8,caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Aim's Jubilee
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,pressured 3/8,met toward 1/4,off rail turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Saucy
ENTRY.OWNER: Mohler Michael L and Calhoun Amanda

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 61. Claiming Purse 7800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE AUGUST 12, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 12, 2022 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Races Not Considered In E ligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: URKILLINGMEBETH settled off the rail on the opening turn then started a bid toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn, left the turn about the three path, took the lead nearing mid-stretch and drew away later yards. STYLISH PAINT stalked two deep, challenged toward the five sixteenths pole and contested even terms two deep on the far turn, took the nod approaching the head of the lane, was caught toward mid-stretch but continued in the duel for second. HIDDEN IDENTITY took the lead and moved to the inside approaching the three quarter pole and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths pole, contested even terms at the rail on the far turn, was caught toward mid-stretch then outfinished in the duel for second. LIFE IN FLASH saved ground well back from early contention, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole and improved at the rail on the far turn, but flattened stride inside the eighth pole. CHANNEL SCENT raced two deep on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and showed little further. BOCA BIRDIE rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase leaving the half mile pole then flattened in the five path on the far turn. MOJO MATTERS saved ground on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. SO RED THE ROSE rated close to the early pace inside, gave chase past the half mile pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and weakened in the lane. UPSY DAISY DO rounded the first turn in the three path and never factored. FONDA ROMANA steadied soon after the start, rounded the first turn in the three path, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole but weakened in the six path on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Stylish Paint
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Urkillingmebeth
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 12 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 12 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HAPPY CLOUDS settled off the pace in the two and three paths, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn but dug in determinedly to inch ahead through later yards. COMPLETE SURPRISE rated the pace inside, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole and contested the edge at the rail on the far turn, dug in gamely to the challenge of Happy Clouds leaving the turn but reluctantly ceded later yards. LACE REVOLUTION saved ground on the first turn, eased out and gave chase into the backstretch, raced at the rail on the far turn, closed for third inside the sixteenth pole and was gaining slowly on the top two. MOONLIT SHADOW rated close inside, challenged toward the three eighths pole but dropped back at the quarter, raced at the rail on the far turn and flattened in the lane. BABY MAN stalked off the rail and stayed in range through the backstretch, but showed little response in the four path of the far turn. AZZURRA rounded the first turn about the four path, showed little response through the backstretch and raced in the five path of the far turn. OCEAN LILLY showed little response.

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Robert B. Tillyer & Dr. Chet Blackey & Sebastien Murat

ENTRY.NAME: Baby Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,little response 4p far turn,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 12 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 12 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBA'S PARADE was reluctant to load then drifted to the three path into the first turn and stalked through the turn, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole, took the nod toward the five sixteenths, dueled clear at the quarter and was kept alert in the stretch. JUMPIN JACK BRASS was bumped leaving the gate then saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the five sixteenths pole, circled rivals five wide on the far turn and dug in to take second the final yards. PHILMARY CASTLE took the lead while tapering to the inside and rated the pace, dug in to the challenge of Juba's Parade leaving the seven sixteenths pole, was met at even terms at the three eighths and relinquished the advantage toward the five sixteenths, dropped back at the rail at the quarter pole then flattened the final sixteenth. SILVER RULES ducked in and made contact with Jumpin Jack Brass leaving the gate, raced in the four path on the first turn and picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn four wide then flattened in the lane. LUCKY BOP became anxious in the gate then saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail but angled to the six path toward the head of the lane and showed little further. IHEARTRAINACOMN was carried to the four path into the first turn then rated close through the turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, though, flattened in the three path on the far turn. SPARKLEINYOUREYE raced off the rail on the opening turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole but weakened into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Bop
ENTRY.COMMENT: anxious in gate,saved ground,chase 7/16,rail far turn,6p1/8,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Philmary Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,dug in from 7/16,met toward 5/16,rail turn,flatten1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 12, 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 12 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Ra ces Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHERIFF'S KID rated a slim early lead inside, was met at the nine sixteenths pole and gave chase from that point, dropped back at the quarter pole, raced close through the turn then eased just outside FLAT DISCOUNT in the upper stretch, dug in to recover the lead later yards and ran clear under the wire. The latter closed to contention early and stalked into the first turn, took the lead into the backstretch and rated the pace, came under pressure toward the five sixteenths pole, dueled clear at the quarter, dug in under steady handling leaving the far turn but was met, and relented later yards. CICI UNIFIED settled off the rail on the opening turn, started a bid toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and dueled through the stretch for third. EMMA AND I saved ground off the pace, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. MARKETABILITY raced well off the pace in the four path on the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, angled to the five path through the far turn and passed some rivals in the lane. SALTY SAUL saved ground on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then flattened stride. TIZ MICHELLE'S WAY rated close to the early pace off the rail, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened in the four path on the far turn. WEST VIRGINIA PAM rounded the first turn in the four path, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened in the five path of the far turn. MISS WILD lunged leaving the gate and was shuffled back shortly afterward, raced in the three path the first turn, left the turn outside and showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Marketability
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 4p,chased 7/16,angled 5p far turn,passed rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Sheriff's Kid
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,met 9/16,chased,close turn,dug in,up late,cleared
